page.title: 06CUSTOMS-RADCLIFFE CARNIVAL
page.content: THE FIRST SATURDAY IN JUNE IS RADCLIFFE CARNIVAL DAY THIS YEAR,1985 WAS ITS 20TH ANNIVERSARY.THE AIM IS TO RAISE AS MUCH MONEY FOR LOCAL CHARITIESA COMMITTEE IS FORMED TO PLAN AND DISCUSS NEW IDEAS,COMPETITIONS ARE HELD TO CHOOSE A QUEEN,A PRINCESS AND A MISS ROSEBUD FORM LOCAL GIRLS. ORGANISATIONS FROM THE TOWN TAKE PART e.g. YOUTH CLUBS,THE ROTARY CLUB AND OTHER CLUBS.LORRIES ARE DECORATED IN A DIFFERENT THEME EACH YEAR e.g. AN OLD TIME MUSIC HALL.CARS ARE DECORATED WITH COLOURED PAPER FLOWERS AND MOTIFS.ON THE ROOF OR BONNET SIT QUEENS FROM OTHER TOWNS.LEADING THE PROCESSION ARE POLICE HORSES,OUR CARNIVAL QUEEN AND PRINCESSES ON A LORRY(FLOAT). THE FLOATS AND CARS ARE JUDGED AND TROPHIES ARE AWARDED.
